t: Isaiah 44
Spiritual Blessing
“And*pn now listen, Jacob my servant, Israel*ln whom I have chosen.
This*ln is the word of the Lord*s your*ln Maker, the one who formed you from the womb: He*ln will help you. Do*ln not fear, Jacob my servant, Jeshurun*ln whom I have chosen.
For*ln I will pour water on the thirsty land and*ln streams on the dry ground; I*ln will pour out my Spirit on your descendants and*ln my blessing on your offspring.
They*ln will sprout among the grass like*ln poplars by flowing streams.
This*ln one will say, ‘I am the Lord*s ’s’; another*ln will use the name of Jacob; still*ln another will write on his hand, ‘The Lord*s ’s,’ and*ln take on the name of Israel.”
No God Other Than the Lord
This*p is what the Lord,*s the King of Israel and its Redeemer, the Lord*s of Armies, says: I*pn am the first and I am the last. There*ln is no God but me.

Who,*ln like me, can announce the future? Let*ln him say so and make a case before me, since*ln I have established an ancient people. Let*ln these gods declare the coming things, and*ln what will take place.
Do*ln not be startled or afraid. Have*ln I not told you and declared it long ago? You*ln are my witnesses! Is*ln there any God but me? There*ln is no other Rock; I do not know any.
All*pn who make idols are nothing, and*ln what they treasure benefits no one. Their*ln witnesses do not see or know anything, so*ln they will be put to shame.
Who*ln makes a god or casts a metal image that*ln benefits no one?
Look,*ln all its worshipers will be put to shame, and*ln the craftsmen are humans. They*ln all will assemble and stand; they*ln all will be startled and put to shame.
The*pn ironworker labors over the coals, shapes*ln the idol with hammers, and*ln works it with his strong arm. Also*ln he grows hungry and his strength fails; he*ln doesn’t drink water and is faint.

The*ln woodworker stretches out a measuring line, he*ln outlines it with a stylus; he*ln shapes it with chisels and*ln outlines it with a compass. He*ln makes it according to a human form, like*ln a beautiful person, to*ln dwell in a temple.
He*ln cuts down cedars for his use, or*ln he takes a cypress or an oak. He*ln lets it grow strong among the trees of the forest. He*ln plants a laurel, and the rain makes it grow.

A*ln person can use it for fuel. He*ln takes some of it and warms himself; also*ln he kindles a fire and bakes bread; he*ln even makes it into a god and worships it; he*ln makes an idol from it and bows down to it.
He*ln burns half of it in a fire, and*ln he roasts meat on that half. He*ln eats the roast and is satisfied. He*ln warms himself and says, “Ah! I*ln am warm, I see the blaze.”
He*ln makes a god or his idol with the rest of it. He*ln bows down to it and worships; he*ln prays to it, “Save me, for you are my god.”
Such*ln people do not comprehend and*ln cannot understand, for*ln he has shut their eyes so they cannot see, and*ln their minds so they cannot understand.

No*ln one comes to his senses; no*ln one has the perception or insight to say, “I*ln burned half of it in the fire, I*ln also baked bread on its coals, I*ln roasted meat and ate. Should*ln I make something detestable with the rest of it? Should*ln I bow down to a block of wood?”
He*ln feeds on ashes. His*ln deceived mind has led him astray, and*ln he cannot rescue himself, or*ln say, “Isn’t there a lie in my right hand?”
Remember*pn these things, Jacob, and*ln Israel, for you are my servant; I*ln formed you, you are my servant; Israel,*ln you will never be forgotten by me.
I*ln have swept away your transgressions like a cloud, and*ln your sins like a mist. Return*ln to me, for*ln I have redeemed you.

Rejoice,*ln heavens, for the Lord*s has acted; shout,*ln depths of the earth. Break*ln out into singing, mountains, forest,*ln and every tree in it. For*ln the Lord*s has redeemed Jacob, and*ln glorifies himself through Israel.
Restoration of Israel through Cyrus
This*p is what the Lord,*s your Redeemer who formed you from the womb, says: I*pn am the Lord,*s who made everything; who*ln stretched out the heavens by myself; who*ln alone spread out the earth;
who*ln destroys the omens of the false prophets and*ln makes fools of diviners; who*ln confounds the wise and*ln makes their knowledge foolishness;

who*ln confirms the message of his servant and*ln fulfills the counsel of his messengers; who*ln says to Jerusalem, “She will be inhabited,” and*ln to the cities of Judah, “They will be rebuilt,” and*ln I will restore her ruins;
who*ln says to the depths of the sea, “Be dry,” and*ln I will dry up your rivers;
who*ln says to Cyrus, “My shepherd, he*ln will fulfill all my pleasure” and*ln says to Jerusalem, “She will be rebuilt,” and*ln of the temple, “Its foundation will be laid.”
